title: Maldives huracain
content: In 2020, the Maldives experienced the severe effects of Cyclone Kyarr, one of the most powerful storms to form in the Arabian Sea in decades. Although it did not make direct landfall, the cyclone brought torrential rains, strong winds, and unusually high tides that flooded low-lying islands, damaging homes, eroding beaches, and disrupting transportation and fishing activities. The event underscored the Maldivesâ€™ vulnerability to climate change and extreme weather, sparking renewed discussions on coastal protection and disaster preparedness.
